title: What are the best books to learn analysis in a completely pure way? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which books are best depends entirely on your level of sophistication. I’ll start at the calculus level and work my way up. Michael Spivak’s Calculus is a classic. A good text after that is Kenneth Ross’s Elementary Analysis: The Theory of Calculus. At that same level is Walter Rudin’s Principles of Mathematical Analysis (sometimes known as “baby” Rudin). At the next level, there are the standards - Rudin’s Real and Complex Analysis, H. L. Royden’s Real Analysis, Tom Apostol’s Mathematical Analysis, P. Halmos Measure Theory. For a different take, you might look at J. Dieudonne’s Foundations of Modern Analysis followed by his five-volume treatise Treatise on Analysis. I hope those suggestions help.
